title: Quick Swap
hint: Delete first arg, navigate to end, paste it back
solutionExplanation: dw — deletes the first argument 'bar, '. e — moves to end of 'baz'. a — appends after cursor. Type ', bar'. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Wrap It Up
hint: Insert paren at start, append paren at end
solutionExplanation: i( — enters Insert mode and types '('. <Esc> — back to Normal. A) — appends ')' at end of line. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Comment Out
hint: Insert // at line start, then repeat with j. on each line
solutionExplanation: I// <Esc> — inserts '// ' at line start. j. — moves down and repeats. j. — repeats on line 3. The dot command replays the last insert.

title: Tag Rewrite
hint: Use cit to change inside the HTML tag
solutionExplanation: cit — 'change inside tag': deletes the content between HTML tags and enters Insert mode. Type 'new'. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Nested Parens
hint: Use ci( to change inside the inner parentheses
solutionExplanation: ci( — 'change inside parentheses': changes the content of the inner parentheses. Type 'x'. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Quote Flip
hint: Use f" to find the quote, replace it, then use ; to find next
solutionExplanation: f" — finds the next double quote. r' — replaces it with single quote. , — not used here; instead the second pair f",r' finds and replaces the closing quote.

title: Duplicate and Edit
hint: Duplicate line with yyp, then change the variable name and value
solutionExplanation: yyp — duplicates the line. w — moves to the second word. cw — changes it to 'height'. <Esc> — Normal mode. f1 — finds '1'. r2 — replaces it with '2'.

title: Move Function Up
hint: Delete the line and paste it above the first line
solutionExplanation: dd — deletes the current line. gg — jumps to line 1. P — pastes above, placing 'function a()' before 'function b()'.

title: Yank Inner Paste
hint: Yank inside quotes on first line, then paste inside quotes on second
solutionExplanation: yi" — yanks the text inside double quotes ('hello'). j — moves to next line. P — pastes before cursor, inserting 'hello' inside the empty quotes.

title: Jump and Fix
hint: Use G to go to last line, then f to find the typo and fix it
solutionExplanation: G — jumps to last line. f( — finds '('. fl — finds 'l' in 'totl'. i — enters Insert. a — types 'a'. <Esc> — fixes 'totl' to 'total'.

title: Number Jump

before.text:
line one
line two
line three
line four
line five
line six
line seven
line eight
line nine
fix this line

after.text:
line one
line two
line three
line four
line five
line six
line seven
line eight
line nine
fixed this line

hint: Use 10G to jump directly to line 10, then fix the word
solutionExplanation: 10G — jumps to line 10 using a line number. e — moves to end of 'fix'. a — appends after cursor. Type 'ed'. <Esc> — changes 'fix' to 'fixed'.

title: Paragraph Hop

before.text:
first block
of text

second block
of text

third blck
of text

after.text:
first block
of text

second block
of text

third block
of text

hint: Use } to jump between paragraphs, then fix the typo
solutionExplanation: }} — jumps forward two paragraphs. fc — finds 'c' in 'blck'. r — not used directly; instead rck inserts the missing 'o'. Actually: fc — finds 'c'. <C-r>ck — replaces to fix 'blck' to 'block'.

title: Regex Replace
hint: Use :%s with a pattern to replace = with : across all lines
solutionExplanation: :%s/ = /: /g<CR> — global substitute: replaces ' = ' with ': ' across all lines in the file.

title: Strip Trailing
hint: Use :%s with regex to remove trailing whitespace
solutionExplanation: :%s/\s\+$//<CR> — regex substitute: \s\+ matches one or more whitespace characters, $ anchors to end of line. Replaces trailing whitespace with nothing.

title: Add Prefix
hint: Use :%s/^/self./ to add a prefix to every line
solutionExplanation: :%s/^/self./<CR> — the ^ matches the start of each line. Inserts 'self.' at the beginning of every line.

title: Column Insert
hint: Use Ctrl-V for visual block mode, select column, then I to insert
solutionExplanation: <C-v> — enters Visual Block mode. jj — extends selection down 2 lines. I — enters Insert mode at the block start. Type '- '. <Esc> — inserts on all selected lines.

title: Column Delete

before.text:
| a | b |
| c | d |
| e | f |

after.text:
a | b |
 c | d |
 e | f |

hint: Use Ctrl-V to select a column of pipe characters, then delete
solutionExplanation: <C-v> — enters Visual Block mode. jj — selects down 2 lines. x — deletes the selected column of pipe characters.

title: Append Semicolons

before.text:
let a = 1
let b = 2
let c = 3
let d = 4

hint: Use Ctrl-V, select all lines to end with $, then A to append
solutionExplanation: <C-v> — Visual Block mode. 3j — selects 4 lines. $ — extends to end of each line. A; — appends ';' at the end of each line. <Esc> — applies the change.

title: Indent Block
hint: Use >> to indent the current line
solutionExplanation: >> — indents the current line by one shiftwidth (2 spaces).

title: Indent Function Body
hint: Select lines with V, then > to indent the selection
solutionExplanation: V — enters Visual Line mode. j — extends selection down one line. >> — indents the selected lines by one shiftwidth.

title: Join Lines
hint: Use J to join two lines
solutionExplanation: J — joins the current line with the next line, replacing the newline with a space.

title: Macro Quotes
hint: Record a macro that wraps a line in quotes and adds comma, then replay
solutionExplanation: qa — starts recording macro into register a. I"<Esc>A",<Esc>j — wraps line in quotes with comma, moves down. q — stops recording. 4@a — replays 4 times.

title: Numbering Lines
hint: Use a macro or :%s with line numbers to prepend numbering
solutionExplanation: <C-v>jj — selects a column across 3 lines. I1. <Esc> — inserts '1. ' on all lines. gv — reselects. g<C-a> — creates a sequential numbering (1, 2, 3).

title: Macro Transform
hint: Record a macro to replace : with = and add ;, then replay on remaining lines
solutionExplanation: qa — starts recording macro. f: — finds ':'. r= — replaces with '='. A;<Esc> — appends semicolon. j — moves down. q — stops. 2@a — replays twice.

title: Swap Two Lines

before.text:
import b from 'b';
import a from 'a';

after.text:
import a from 'a';
import b from 'b';

hint: Use ddp to swap two lines
solutionExplanation: ddp — dd deletes the current line, p pastes it below. This swaps two adjacent lines.

title: Delete Block

before.text:
keep this

delete
this
block

keep this too

hint: Use dip to delete inner paragraph (the block of lines)
solutionExplanation: dip — 'delete inner paragraph': deletes the contiguous block of non-blank lines under the cursor.

title: Copy Block Down
hint: Select all lines visually, yank, go to end, paste
solutionExplanation: V — Visual Line mode. jj — selects all 3 lines. y — yanks them. p — pastes below, duplicating the block.

title: Extract Variable
hint: Change 0.9 to variable name, open line above and define it
solutionExplanation: cw — changes '0.9' to 'discount'. <Esc> — Normal mode. O — opens line above. Types 'const ' then <C-r>. inserts last inserted text, ' = ' and <C-r>" inserts the deleted text, ';'.

title: Rename Symbol
hint: Use :%s to rename the variable across all lines
solutionExplanation: :%s/cnt/count/<CR> — substitutes 'cnt' with 'count' on every line in the file.

title: Unwrap Function
hint: Delete the wrapper function call while keeping the inner call
solutionExplanation: F( — finds '(' backward. x — deletes it. $ — goes to end. x — deletes ')'. 0 — goes to start. dw — deletes 'wrapper'.

title: CSV to Lines
hint: Use :s to replace commas with newlines
solutionExplanation: :s/,/\r/g<CR> — substitutes all commas with newline characters (\r) on the current line, splitting CSV into separate lines.

title: Lines to CSV
hint: Join lines with J, then replace spaces with commas
solutionExplanation: 3J — joins 4 lines (current + 3 below) into one line with spaces. V — selects the line. r, — replaces all characters in the selection... Actually: joins lines, then uses Vr, to replace spaces with commas.

title: Mirror Array
hint: Delete first number, navigate to after last, paste it, then fix the other end
solutionExplanation: f1 — finds '1'. r3 — replaces with '3'. f3 — finds the original '3'. r1 — replaces with '1'. Swaps first and last numbers.

title: Snake to Camel
hint: Use f_ to find underscores, x to delete, then ~ to uppercase next char
solutionExplanation: f_ — finds first underscore. x — deletes it. ~ — toggles next char to uppercase. Repeat f_x~ for the second underscore. Converts snake_case to camelCase.

title: Increment All
hint: Use Ctrl-V to select the number column, then Ctrl-A to increment all
solutionExplanation: <C-v> — Visual Block mode. 4jl — selects number column across 5 lines. <C-a> — increments all selected numbers by 1.

title: Double Delete
hint: Use d2w to delete two words at once
solutionExplanation: d2w — the d operator with count 2 and w motion deletes two words ('two three ') from the cursor position.

title: HTML List
hint: Record a macro to wrap each line in <li> tags, then replay
solutionExplanation:
qa — starts macro. I
  • A
    • j — wraps line in li tags, moves down. q — stops. 2@a — replays twice for remaining lines.

title: Reverse Assignment
hint: Use substitute with capture groups to swap sides of assignment
solutionExplanation: cw — changes 'left' to 'right'. <Esc> — Normal mode. fr — finds 'r' in 'right'. cw — changes to the deleted text using <C-r>". <Esc> — done.

title: Array to Object

after.text:
name: name,
age: age,
email: email

hint: Use substitute to transform CSV into key-value pairs
solutionExplanation: :s/\w\+/: &/g — adds ': ' before each word (& references the match). |s/, /,\r/g — chains a second substitute to split on commas into new lines.

title: Sort and Dedupe

before.text:
c
a
b
a
c
b

hint: Use :sort u to sort and remove duplicates in one command
solutionExplanation: :sort u<CR> — the :sort command with 'u' flag sorts all lines alphabetically and removes duplicates in one operation.

title: Global Delete

after.text:
keep this
keep this too
and this

hint: Use :g/pattern/d to delete all lines matching a pattern
solutionExplanation: :g/\/\//d<CR> — the :global command finds all lines matching '//' and deletes them. Backslashes escape the forward slashes.

title: Norm Command

before.text:
item one
item two
item three
item four
item five

after.text:
ITEM one
ITEM two
ITEM three
ITEM four
ITEM five

hint: Use :%norm with gUiw to uppercase first word on every line
solutionExplanation: :%norm gUiw<CR> — runs the Normal mode command 'gUiw' (uppercase inner word) on every line in the file.

title: Final Boss: Config Rewrite

before.text:
host = localhost
port = 3000
mode = development
debug = true

hint: Combine substitution with uppercase to transform config format
solutionExplanation: :%s/\v(\w+) = (.+)/\U\1: "\2"/<CR> — uses \v (very magic) regex with capture groups. \U uppercases \1 (the key), wraps \2 (the value) in quotes, and changes = to :.

title: Final Boss: Table Format
hint: Use substitute to wrap each line in table format with pipes
solutionExplanation: :%s/\v(.+) (.+)/| \1 | \2 |/<CR> — captures the name and score, then wraps them in pipe-delimited table format.

title: Graduation: Full Refactor
hint: Use two :%s commands to rename var→const and console.log→print
solutionExplanation: :%s/var/const/g<CR> — replaces all 'var' with 'const'. :%s/console.log/print/g<CR> — replaces all 'console.log' with 'print'. Two global substitutions.

title: Quote Wrap
hint: Insert a quote at start and append one at end
solutionExplanation: i"<Esc> — enters Insert mode and types a quote before the word. A"<Esc> — appends a quote at the end of the line.

title: Comment Prefix
hint: Use I to insert // at the start
solutionExplanation: I// <Esc> — enters Insert mode at the beginning of the line and types '// ' to add a comment prefix.

title: Clear Brackets
hint: Use ci[ to clear the content inside brackets
solutionExplanation: ci[ — 'change inside brackets': deletes everything between [ and ] and enters Insert mode. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode immediately, leaving empty brackets.

title: Change Tag Content
hint: Use cit to change inside the tag
solutionExplanation: cit — 'change inside tag': deletes the content between HTML tags. Type 'cold'. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Duplicate Value
hint: Duplicate the line, then replace the number
solutionExplanation: yyp — duplicates the line below. f1 — finds the '1' character. r2 — replaces it with '2'.

title: Paste After Second
hint: Yank the first line, move down, then paste
solutionExplanation: yy — yanks the current line. j — moves down one line. p — pastes the yanked line below.

title: Mark and Fix
hint: Set a mark, fix the end, then jump back to append !
solutionExplanation: ma — sets mark 'a' at current position. G$ — jumps to end of last line. x — deletes extra 'h'. 'a — jumps back to mark 'a'. A!<Esc> — appends '!' at end of line.

title: Mark Return
hint: Mark the first line, fix the last, then jump back
solutionExplanation: ry — replaces 'x' with 'y' on line 1. G — jumps to last line. ry — replaces 'x' with 'y' on line 3.

title: Swap Dashes
hint: Use :%s to replace dashes with underscores
solutionExplanation: :%s/-/_/<CR> — substitutes the first '-' with '_' on every line in the file.

title: Capitalize Key

before.text:
name: Alice
name: Bob
name: Eve

after.text:
Name: Alice
Name: Bob
Name: Eve

hint: Use :%s/^name/Name/ to change the prefix
solutionExplanation: :%s/^./\u&/<CR> — matches the first character of each line (^.), \u uppercases the next character, & references the full match. Capitalizes the first letter.

title: Column Replace
hint: Use Ctrl-V to select the column, then r=
solutionExplanation: <C-v> — Visual Block mode. jj — selects the column down 2 lines. r= — replaces all selected characters with '='.

title: Column Commas
hint: Use Ctrl-V, extend to end, then A,
solutionExplanation: <C-v> — Visual Block mode. jj — selects down. $ — extends to end of each line. A, — appends ',' at end of each selected line. <Esc> — applies.

title: Indent Two Lines
hint: Select two lines and indent with >
solutionExplanation: V — Visual Line mode. j — extends selection to include next line. >> — indents both selected lines.

title: Join Three
hint: Use J twice to join three lines
solutionExplanation: JJ — J joins current line with next (twice), combining three lines into one separated by spaces.

title: Bracket Wrap
hint: Record a macro to wrap each line in brackets, then replay
solutionExplanation: qa — starts macro. I[<Esc>A]<Esc>j — wraps line in brackets, moves down. q — stops. 3@a — replays 3 times.

title: Macro Spacing
hint: Record a macro to space around = and append ;, then replay
solutionExplanation: qa — starts macro. f= — finds '='. s — deletes '=' and enters Insert. Types ' = '. <Esc> — Normal. A;<Esc> — appends ';'. j0 — next line start. q — stops. 2@a — replays twice.

title: Swap Middle Lines
hint: Use ddp to swap with the next line
solutionExplanation: ddp — deletes the current line and pastes it below the next line, swapping 'two' and 'three'.

title: Move Line Up
hint: Delete the line and paste it above
solutionExplanation: dd — deletes 'third'. k — moves up one line. P — pastes above, placing 'third' before 'second'.

title: Inline Variable
hint: Change tmp to calc(), then delete the temp line
solutionExplanation: cw — changes 'tmp' to 'calc()'. <Esc> — Normal mode. k — moves up. dd — deletes the temporary variable line.

title: Rename Function
hint: Use :%s to rename the function everywhere
solutionExplanation: :%s/do_it/run/g<CR> — global substitute: replaces all occurrences of 'do_it' with 'run' across every line.

title: Kebab Case
hint: Use :s to replace underscores with dashes
solutionExplanation: :s/_/-/g<CR> — substitutes all underscores with dashes on the current line.

title: Add Braces
hint: Insert { at start and append } at end
solutionExplanation: I{ <Esc> — inserts '{ ' at the beginning of the line. A }<Esc> — appends ' }' at the end.

title: Triple Delete
hint: Use 3x to delete three characters quickly
solutionExplanation: 3x — deletes 3 characters starting from the cursor position using a count prefix with x.

title: Quick Change
hint: Use cw to change the word under cursor
solutionExplanation: cw — 'change word': deletes 'brown' and enters Insert mode. Type 'red'. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Swap Columns
hint: Use substitute with capture groups to swap columns
solutionExplanation: :%s/\v(.) (.)/\2 \1/<CR> — regex with capture groups: captures single char, space, single char, then swaps them.

title: Key Value Split
hint: Use substitute to turn space into : between words
solutionExplanation: :%s/ /: /<CR> — replaces the first space on each line with ': ', converting 'word word' to 'word: word'.

title: Remove Blank Lines
hint: Use :g/^$/d to delete blank lines
solutionExplanation: :g/^$/d<CR> — the :global command matches empty lines (^$ = start immediately followed by end) and deletes them.

title: Append Semicolons
hint: Use :%norm to append ; on every line
solutionExplanation: :%s/$/;/<CR> — the $ matches the end of each line. Appends ';' to every line in the file.

title: Final Boss: Export Lines

after.text:
export PATH=/bin
export HOME=/home/user
export SHELL=/bin/bash

hint: Use :%s/^/export / to prefix each line
solutionExplanation: :%s/^/export /<CR> — the ^ matches the start of each line. Prepends 'export ' to every line.

title: Final Boss: Upper Keys
hint: Use substitute with \U to uppercase the keys
solutionExplanation: :%s/^[^=]*/\U&/<CR> — matches everything before '=' on each line, \U uppercases the entire match (&). Converts keys to uppercase.

title: Decrement All
hint: Use Ctrl-V to select the number column, then Ctrl-X to decrement all at once
solutionExplanation: <C-v> — Visual Block mode. 4jl — selects the number column across 5 lines. <C-x> — decrements all selected numbers by 1.
